title: How to Enable Macros in Microsoft Word on Windows or Mac

steps.title: Open Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Word . If it opens to a file rather than the home page, click File in the top-left corner to be redirected. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . This is in the left panel, at the very bottom. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Trust Center.
steps.content: Click Trust Center . This is the last option in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Trust Center Settings.
steps.content: Click Trust Center Settings . You can find this button in the bottom section. A new window will open. If you aren't already on the Macro Settings tab, click it in the left panel now.

steps.title: Select an option.
steps.content: Select an option. It's recommended to avoid enabling all macros as this poses security risks for your computer. Disable all macros except digitally signed macros : the macro will run if published by a trusted publisher Enable all macros : all macros will run without confirmation

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . The macro setting will be applied.
